title: Paulini Curuenavuli talks about the backlash she faced after she paid for a fake driver's license
text:
Paulini Curuenavuli has spoken out about her conviction after she was found guilty of bribing a government employee to receive a driver's license back in 2017.

Fronting court in December 2017, the 37-year-old former Australian Idol star was handed a a six-month suspended jail term after pleading guilty to paying $850 for a fake driver's license.

In an interview with Now to Love on Wednesday, Paulini spoke about how the public backlash she experienced following the scandal left her devastated.

Opening up: Paulini Curuenavuli has spoken out about her conviction after she was found guilty of bribing a government employee to receive a driver's license back in 2017

'It really used to get to me,' she confessed.

But Paulini said she grew from the experience, and having to deal with so much public criticism ultimately made her stronger.

'I've grown up and I've got such a thick skin now and things like that don't bother me anymore,' she added.

Tough time: In an interview with Now to Love on Wednesday, Paulini spoke about how the public backlash she experienced following her driver's license scandal had left her devastated

Life lessons: Paulini said she grew from the experience, and having to deal with so much public criticism ultimately made her stronger

'At first when I did go through all of those things, it used to break me down. It still does. We're all human. We still react to these things and it still affects you in different ways, but I've learnt how to deal with it.'

After rising to fame on Australian Idol back in 2003, Paulini claimed a rough patch in her life led her to make poor choices.

'I went through a very traumatic breakup from a tumultuous relationship,' she wrote in a letter to the court, obtained by The Daily Telegraph in January 2018.

'At first when I did go through all of those things, it used to break me down. It still does. We're all human,' she confessed

'I am embarrassed to say this was not the first relationship I had been in involving domestic violence and low self-esteem.

'In addition to the breakdown of my relationship, my failed album release had cost me my savings and the relationship with the record label.'

But Paulini appears to have since gotten her life back on track, appearing as the lead in The Bodyguard musical, and being revealed as the Spider on The Masked Singer.
